abstract: The ruling voided two foreclosures, putting the nation’s banks on notice that foreclosures cannot be based on improper or incomplete paperwork.
snippet: The ruling voided two foreclosures, putting the nation’s banks on notice that foreclosures cannot be based on improper or incomplete paperwork.
lead_paragraph: The highest court in Massachusetts ruled Friday that U.S. Bancorp and Wells Fargo erred when they seized two troubled borrowers’ properties in 2007, putting the nation’s banks on notice that foreclosures cannot be based on improper or incomplete paperwork.

headline.main: Massachusetts Ruling on Foreclosures Is a Warning to Banks
headline.print_headline: Voided Foreclosures A Warning to Banks
